title: Divided Supreme Court Rejects Bid for Religious Charter School in Oklahoma
description: In a 4-to-4 decision, the court upheld a ruling by the Oklahoma Supreme Court that blocked the school.

title: D.C. Shooting Kills 2 at Jewish Museum, and House Passes Trumps Beautiful Bill
description: Plus, breakfast cereals are getting less healthy.

title: South Africa Wanted to Talk Trade. Then Trump Turned Down the Lights.
description: In a bruising Oval Office meeting, the visitors plan to keep President Trump from focusing on false accusations of white genocide backfired spectacularly.

title: Inside the Oval Office Meeting With South Africas President
description: John Eligon, Johannesburg bureau chief, recounts what he witnessed in the Oval Office when President Trump confronted the visiting President Cyril Ramaphosa of South Africa with an elaborate presentation attempting to falsely prove a genocide against white Afrikaners.

title: Trump Casts Himself as a Protector of Persecuted White People
description: President Trump publicly dressed down the president of South Africa based on a fringe conspiracy theory, providing a vivid distillation of his views on race.

title: Trump Claimed a Video Showed Burial Sites of White Farmers. It Didnt.
description: During a meeting with South Africas president, President Trump played the video as evidence of racial persecution. A Times analysis found he misrepresented the contents of the video.

title: 21 Nonfiction Books Coming this Summer
description: How did streetwear become high fashion? Why are there so many serial killers in the Pacific Northwest? Prize-winning writers tackle these questions, while memoirists consider celibacy, spycraft and Erica Jong.

title: New Novels to Read This Summer
description: Taylor Jenkins Reid heads to space, Megan Abbott climbs a pyramid scheme and Gary Shteyngart channels a 10-year-old. Plus queer vampires, a professor in hell and an actresss revenge.

title: 4 Summer Books Were Looking Forward To
description: Gilbert Cruz, the editor of The New York Times Book Review, previews four books were anticipating this summer.

title: As the Soviet Union Fell, Did the K.G.B. Leave Behind a Gift in Brazil?
description: A forensic analysis of birth certificates used by deep-cover operatives suggests a tantalizing possibility.

title: How Daniel Led Our Reporters to an Assembly Line for Russian Spies
description: For years, Russia used Brazil as a launchpad for its most elite intelligence officers, known as illegals. They started businesses, made friends and had love affairs  events that, over many years, became the building blocks of entirely new identities. Jane Bradley and Michael Schwirtz, investigative reporters for The New York Times, discuss one case.

title: Russia Used Brazil to Create Deep-Cover Spies
description: Russias intelligence services turned Brazil into an assembly line for deep-cover operatives. A team of federal agents from the South American country has been quietly dismantling it.

title: Kennedy and Trump to Release Report Calling Chronic Disease a Crisis
description: The report is already receiving pushback from some Republicans and the agriculture industry over fears about the health secretarys longtime crusade against agricultural chemicals.

title: Inside Trump Officials Debate Over Abrego Garcias Deportation
description: A Maryland mans deportation to El Salvador set off a fierce debate among officials in three cabinet agencies, despite agreement there had been a mistake.

title: Kim Jong-un Vents Fury After Botched Launch of North Korean Destroyer
description: He vows to punish as criminals those responsible for the failure, in which the ship had its hull torn open and ended up on its side in the water.

title: Alberta Separatism Push Roils Canada
description: The country is just emerging from a period of political turmoil with a new prime minister in place. But now Alberta, a conservative Western province, is planning a referendum to break away.

title: After Biden and Connolly, Some Democrats Wonder Should Age and Term Limits Exist?
description: After Joe Bidens cancer diagnosis and Representative Gerry Connollys death, some in the party want more elected officials, as one Democrat put it, to seek an earlier escape hatch from politics.

title: Pope Leos Doctoral Dissertation Thoughts on Power and Authority
description: There is no room in Augustines concept of authority for one who is self-seeking and in search of power over others, he wrote in the 167-page text.

title: Jeff Goldblum Says Jeff Goldblum Is Not a Performance
description: In a wide-ranging interview on Popcast, the actor and musician insisted that the immutable Jeff Goldblum persona is not a performance  its his lifeblood.

title: How Groupthink Protected Biden and Re-elected Trump
description: Was there a Joe Biden cover-up? Jake Tapper examines the people and institutions that made the former presidents re-election campaign possible.

title: David Souter Knew When to Step Down
description: David Souter set an example more leaders should follow.

title: Deportees Went Where?
description: We examine the governments deportation policies.

title: Late Night Thinks Trumps White Genocide Video Was a Bit Much
description: The guy who couldnt find South Africa on a map of Africa subjected its leader to an extremely dubious video about his own country, Jimmy Kimmel said.

title: Kid Cudi Is Expected to Testify in the Sean Combs Trial
description: The rapper is scheduled to take the stand on Thursday to describe how his car was blown up after a threat by a jealous Mr. Combs.

title: Inspector Let Recruits Who Failed Psychological Exam Join the N.Y.P.D.
description: Terrell Anderson, the former head of a unit charged with assessing candidates, has been transferred. He has been praised as an innovative officer.

title: Roof of 14th-Century Drum Tower Partially Collapses in China
description: The Drum Tower in Fengyang County, which dates to the 14th century, is one of many historical sites that have been renovated as cultural tourism has boomed.

title: Memorial Day Weekend Tips on Travel Delays, Cancellations and More
description: With airports and airlines experiencing delays and cancellations, and staffing shortfalls at national parks, heres what to know before you go.
